alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 9:56AM CDT until April 09 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River at Moline affecting Rock Island and Henry IL Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River at Moline. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Water affects residences near the 27th Street bridge. Water is over portions of 60th St south of Green Valley Sports Complex and portions of 56th Ave along the north side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 12.2 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The river crested near 12.4 feet Friday evening and is slowly falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 10.6 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 05/27/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
